overview_of_class:
RTVF 379 Senior Directing:

This is the second part of a two-quarter sequence. Following the progress of the first quarter, students will chiefly focus on post-production, but some students will continue to conduct principal shooting during this period.

Class time will center on presentation and critiques of:
? postmortem evaluation of principal photography
? assembly/rough cut presentation and critiques
? presentation on the career, working methods/techniques, aesthetic intentions and
thematic concerns of a professional film director the student finds inspirational

Evaluation will rest on execution of concepts through shooting and post-production, the aesthetic development of the project as concepts shift and continue to evolve, the ability to synthesize criticism into a plan of action, and the ability to aide other students through constructive critical participation in class discussions.

Students are expected to have completed at least one assembly and screen two complete rough cuts (with beginning sound design, temp music, et al) by the end of winter quarter.
